name: Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor
Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width
Lower the bar to your chest in a controlled manner
Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions
cues: Keep your shoulders back and chest up
Maintain a slight arch in your lower back
Don't bounce the bar off your chest
Breathe out on the way up, in on the way down

name: Barbell Back Squat
instructions: Position the barbell across your upper back
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed out
Lower your body by bending your knees and hips
Go down until your thighs are parallel to the floor or lower
Drive back up through your heels to the starting position
cues: Keep your chest up and back straight
Don't let your knees cave inward
Keep your weight on your heels
Look straight ahead, not down

name: Conventional Deadlift
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, bar over mid-foot
Bend at hips and knees, grip the bar just outside your legs
Lift the bar by extending your hips and knees
Pull the bar up until you're standing straight
Lower the bar back to the floor in a controlled manner
cues: Keep your back straight, don't round
Pull the bar close to your body
Engage your core throughout the movement
Drive through your heels, not your toes

name: Standing Overhead Press
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, bar at collarbone level
Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width
Press the bar directly overhead until arms are fully extended
Lower the bar back to collarbone level under control
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions
cues: Keep your core tight and glutes squeezed
Don't arch your back excessively
Keep your elbows slightly forward at the bottom
Press in a straight line, not back

name: Pull-up
instructions: Grab the pull-up bar with hands slightly wider than shoulders
Hang from the bar with arms fully extended
Pull your body up until your chin is over the bar
Lower your body back down in a controlled manner
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions
cues: Keep your shoulders down away from your ears
Engage your core throughout
Don't use momentum or kip
Pull with your back, not just your arms

name: Parallel Bar Dips
instructions: Support yourself between parallel bars with arms extended
Lower your body by bending your elbows
Go down until your shoulders are level with your elbows
Press back up to the starting position
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions
cues: Keep your chest up and shoulders back
Don't lean too far forward or back
Lower under control, don't drop
Keep your elbows pointing back, not out

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbells in hands
Start with arms fully extended, palms facing forward
Curl the weights up by bending your elbows
Squeeze biceps at the top of the movement
Lower the weights back to starting position
cues: Keep your elbows pinned to your sides
Don't use momentum or body swing
Control the negative portion
Don't let your wrists bend back

name: Cable Tricep Pushdown
instructions: Stand facing a cable machine with rope or bar attachment
Grip the attachment with hands about shoulder-width apart
Start with elbows bent and forearms parallel to floor
Push down until arms are fully extended
Slowly return to starting position
cues: Keep your elbows tucked into your sides
Use full range of motion
Squeeze triceps at the bottom
Don't use body momentum

name: Leg Press
instructions: Sit in the leg press machine with feet on the platform
Position feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointed slightly out
Release the safety latches and lower the platform
Lower until knees are at about 90 degrees
Press the platform back to starting position
cues: Don't lock your knees at the top
Keep your lower back pressed against the seat
Control both the positive and negative
Place feet to target different muscle areas

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbells at sides
Keep a slight bend in your elbows throughout
Raise arms out to the sides until level with shoulders
Pause briefly at the top of the movement
Lower weights back to starting position
cues: Keep your core tight and don't arch your back
Don't use momentum to swing the weights
Lead with your elbows, not hands
Control the entire movement
